name: juneberry
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a plant that grows mainly in northwestern parts of North America, or its small fruit that you can eat: The woods are home to the rare Nantucket juneberry, among other precious plants. The juneberry was a staple in Native American cuisine. Juneberries ripen in late June.
imageBROKER/Helmut Meyer zur Capellen/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe saskatoon (Amelanchier ainifolia) is also known as the juneberry or serviceberry.Juneberry fruits resemble blueberries, to which they are often compared.The favourite wild fruits of New York robins are those of mulberry, pokeweed, juneberry, blackberry and raspberry, wild cherry, sumac, woodbine, wild grape, dogwood, and blueberry.
